data.title: Barely a 5 out of 10
data.text: It took our waitress at least 10 minutes to even greet us. Our steaks were undercooked and extremely fatty. I don't think we'll be going back ever.

data.title: Great place for lunch, maybe more
data.text: Been here twice.   Very good place for lunch with an outstanding taco salad.   Super wait staff.   Going back to try their in house made pizza.

data.title: "ChanEvan"
data.text:
Godsey's Grill is one of the Main St. "Private Clubs" that serves alcohol.  

Big space that was almost empty on a weeknight. 

House salad was good.  Side of fried green beans was very good.  Pasta had no dressing or seasoning.  

Filet was way overcooked ~ sent it back.  It came out Rare.  3rd time it was Medium Rare, but was bland, needed seasoning.  

Server Cole was attentive.  

The Club probably fills up & livens up on the weekends when there's music.

data.title: Cool place
data.text: Great environment repurposed building good vibe nice staff good food my wife got the kicking chicken not spicy just tasty I got the pulled pork sauce and meat work well hand cut fries are top notch cool place

data.title: Ok Service but Terrible Food
data.text: I was terribly disappointed in this restaurant. Maybe I went on a bad day but I just don't want to go there again. It was a waste of money. The food had no flavor. We ate it because we were hungry but we both agreed we would never go back. The waitress was friendly but the atmosphere didn't feel right.

data.title: Excellent place for lunch!!
data.text: Excellent place for lunch. I high recommend the Hog Wild Dip with kettle chips. It is out of this world amazing. We had pizzas as well and they were thin crust and delicious. Our server was great, very friendly and helpful with helping us order.

data.title: Down hill fast
data.text: This use to be a great place for a meal. Not sure what happened. They have pizzas, burgers, and nachos. Everything is ok but nothing is great.

data.title: Home made burgers
data.text: This restaurant  is a good place to eat at anytime of the day The special for Tuesday is burger and fries.  This is a family  restaurant.

data.title: Circling the drain
data.text: The food quality, service and cleanliness is spiraling out of control. Employees are rude, juvenile and simply drawing a check. The food has become inedible since the new owners took over. The owners are never on site but spend all their time posting inappropriate personal relationship drama and accusations of infidelity/alcoholism on their Facebook in between belligerent and incomprehensible rants to employees.

data.title: this place is so sorry
data.text: never eating there again go to skinny js if you wwant a good burger who wants to pay 13$ for a quater pounder

data.title: Best Buger Around
data.text: My Shel and I ate here many times and I always get the Buger with the fried egg. It is wonderful. My Shel will try different things and we always have good food.

data.title: New Location at Hilltop
data.text:
What happened? Tried 3 times and gotten worse with each visit. The waiting staff does a great job. Really tries to help. The food has gotten worse. I love the hog wild. It came to the table almost cold. Burger overcooked and bun burnt around the edges. Chips really cooked done as in really brown.
Work at the college and try to find places close to eat for lunch in an hour. Gave up today at the most was 10 customers including us and it was SLLLLLOOOOWWW for us to get our food.
Will find another place for lunch, this is not it. And no ASU discount?

data.title: Rating the new location
data.text: Godsey's as recently opened a new location on HWY 49 just west of the Airport Rd/49 intersection.  My wife and I have been twice and so far, it's been ok. I think they are somewhat under-staffed as of yet.  Service has been friendly so that's a huge plus in my book. I hope once they get over the growing pains the service will speed up. The food I've ordered has been ok, just not great.  We'll be back.

data.title: Terrible doesn't begin to cover it
data.text:
I was incredibly disappointed in my meal this evening. We didn't get drinks (or asked if someone had taken our drink order) for the first half hour. My soup was cold. The entrées took an hour to come out (with cold fries). My chicken was dry and burned. Our waitress refused to make eye contact with us when we tried to get her attention. Two of my sides never came out. The whole ordeal lasted two hours, and I left hungry. We were so frustrated and tired that we paid as quickly as possible and left. 

Hilltop location, you leave a lot to be desired.

data.title: Total Reversal of Opinion
data.text:
We visited this restaurant two years ago when visiting the area.   We recall it as being upbeat with an excellent staff and very good food.   We were in the area again and decided to return, along with several family members.    What a mistake this was!   The manager warned us that they had new staff and to please be patient.  We were and gave the benefit of the doubt so much that we finally had enough.   We learned that they opened a new location, and the management thought it was a good idea to send all of the seasoned wait staff and cooks to the new place, and replace them with those with no experience at all.   I cannot blame the folks trying their best and reflected that in a very nice tip.  The demise of this location is totally the fault of the owner.   Here are a few things that occurred:
1.   No drinks or water for nearly 30 minutes.
2.   Over an hour to get appetizers.  One of them was a dip and not chips were provided.   Took two times to get wait staff to bring and by that time, the dip was cold.
3.   One person ordered prime rib and it came out as a 1/2 inch thick grilled rib steak.  The wait staff and the manager both said that prime rib and rib-eyes were the same.   That is totally incorrect.
4.   It took over 3 hours for us to eat and get out ticket.
5.    The buns on the hamburgers were old and fell apart.   They apparently rubbed butter or something on the outside and heated them up to freshen them, but they just fall apart in your hands.   No good.

It is a shame that the management made this foolhardy decision.   They certainly ruined a very nice place.

data.title: Watch your credit card / debit card
data.text: This has always been a great place to eat. Food is mediocre at best now. Slow/inattentive service.  To top it off our server added a $30 tip to a $50 check despite being tipped at the table. Had to call management and ask for refund.  After verifying that I was correct,  the management offered no reason or apologies for the incident. I am an excellent tipper. Will not be back.

data.title: Great food, normally.
data.text: The food as Godsey's is usually good. However, my husband and I just went to dinner there and we're shocked at the fact that our food had obviously been sitting under a heat lamp, and our server was nowhere to be found throughout most of our meal. I have since spoken with a manager who was also disappointed in the staff. The food is usually really good. I'm hoping our last visit was a fluke.

data.title: Awesome dips and appetizers!
data.text: We always enjoy the great dips and appetizers here. The menu has changed with not as many choices as before but there are still plenty.  We have tried the burgers, other sandwiches, steak, and pizza, all very good and at a reasonable price.  We probably eat here mostly on Fridays but have gone during the week when it is not as crowded.  The service is also very fast and friendly.

data.title: Terrible!
data.text:
Potato chips burnt, queso dip was like from out of a can, ordered pulled pork nachos came out after everyone else was almost finished had can cheese,smoked sausage,
Very little pulled pork and pork & beans! Chips didn't even fill the plate. It will be a long while before we try again😕

data.title: Godsey's, not worth having a name....
data.text: My girlfriend and I went to this terrible place yesterday. Ordered a phili cheese steak with chips, classic club sandwich with fries, and fried pickles for an appetizer. The waiter didn't bother to ask if it was ok to substitute the hoagie bun for wheat bun, just brought it and said oh they were out, the steak was dry to the point they should have just burned it, the chips were not only burnt but cold, lays would have been better, I found 2 pink hairs in my sandwich, obviously from the tattooed waitress with pink hair, in black combat boots. The fries where over cooked in old grease, the toast on the sandwich cold, obviously pree-made. But the water and fried pickles where good, not worth the lack of parking or half hour it took to get terrible food.
